form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Johanns (for himself, Mr. Barrasso, Mr. Paul, Ms. Collins, Mr. Grassley, Mr. Coats, Mr. Johnson of Wisconsin, and Mrs. Fischer) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Homeland Security and Governmental Affairs

form.official-title: To amend chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, to provide for congressional review of agency guidance documents.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Closing Regulatory Loopholes Act of 2013.

section.header: Congressional review of agency guidance documents

subsection.text: Chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, is amended by striking section 804 and inserting the following:

paragraph.text: the term guidance document means a statement of general applicability and future effect by a Federal agency, other than a regulatory action, that sets forth a policy on a statutory, regulatory, or technical issue or an interpretation of a statutory or regulatory issue;

the term major guidance document means any guidance document that the Administrator of the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs of the Office of Management and Budget finds has resulted in or is likely to result in—

subparagraph.text: an annual effect on the economy of $100,000,000 or more;
a major increase in costs or prices for consumers, individual industries, Federal, State, or local government agencies, or geographic regions; or

significant adverse effects on competition, employment, investment, productivity, innovation, or on the ability of United States-based enterprises to compete with foreign-based enterprises in domestic and export markets;
any rule that the Administrator of the Office of Information and Regulatory Affairs of the Office of Management and Budget finds has resulted in or is likely to result in—

clause.text: an annual effect on the economy of $100,000,000 or more;
a major increase in costs or prices for consumers, individual industries, Federal, State, or local government agencies, or geographic regions; or

significant adverse effects on competition, employment, investment, productivity, innovation, or on the ability of United States-based enterprises to compete with foreign-based enterprises in domestic and export markets; and

paragraph.text: the term regulatory action means any substantive action by a Federal agency (normally published in the Federal Register) that promulgates or is expected to lead to the promulgation of a final regulation, including notices of inquiry, advance notices of proposed rulemaking, and notices of proposed rulemaking; and
the term rule has the meaning given the term in section 551, except that the term does not include—

subparagraph.text: any rule of particular applicability, including a rule that approves or prescribes for the future rates, wages, prices, services, or allowances therefor, corporate or financial structures, reorganizations, mergers, or acquisitions thereof, or accounting practices or disclosures bearing on any of the foregoing;
any rule relating to a Federal agency management or personnel; or
any rule of a Federal agency organization, procedure, or practice that does not substantially affect the rights or obligations of non-agency parties.

subsection.text: Chapter 8 of title 5, United States Code, is amended—

subitem.text: by inserting or guidance document after the rule; and
by inserting or major guidance document after major rule; and

subclause.text: by striking subparagraph (B) and inserting the following:

subparagraph.text: On the date of the submission of the report under subparagraph (A), the Federal agency promulgating the rule or guidance document shall submit to the Comptroller General and make available to each House of Congress—

clause.text: in the case of a rule—

subclause.text: a complete copy of the cost-benefit analysis of the rule, if any;
a description of the actions of the Federal agency relevant to sections 603, 604, 605, 607, and 609; and

clause.text: in the case of a guidance document, any relevant agency actions; and
any other relevant information or requirements under any other Act or any relevant Executive order.

subclause.text: in the matter preceding subparagraph (A), by inserting or major guidance document after major rule; and
by inserting or guidance document after a rule; and

clause.text: in paragraph (5), by inserting or guidance document after rule;

subparagraph.text: in subsections (b), (c), and (d), by inserting or guidance document after rule each place it appears; and

clause.text: by inserting or in the case of a guidance document, That Congress disapproves the guidance document submitted by the __ relating to __, and such guidance document shall have no force or effect. (The blank spaces being appropriately filled in) before the period;

subparagraph.text: in subsection (b)(2)(B), by inserting or guidance document after rule; and
in subsection (e), by inserting or guidance document after rule;
by inserting or guidance document after rule; and
by inserting or guidance document's after rule's;
by striking the section heading and inserting the following:
